recipeInstructions.instructions: Add water and salt to medium pot and set on high heat.
Wash rice in water until the water is clear.
Once water in the pot is boiling, add washed rice to water.
After water is boiling again, set heat to medium and cover for 15 mins.
Take off heat and fluff with a fork.
Add butter to pan and set on medium high heat.
Once butter is all melted, coat pan and crack eggs in pan.
Let eggs fry in pan for about 2 mins or until edges of eggs become crispy.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Flip eggs and let cook for another 45 seconds before serving.
Preheat oven to 400F.
Wash and cut all Brussels sprouts in half then spread out on a baking sheet.
Cut bacon into small chunks, about 1/2" x 1/2", and distribute all around brussels sprouts on the baking sheet.
Spread olive oil, salt, and pepper on top of everything.
Mix all items in the baking sheet around to coat everything and evenly spread out.
Put baking sheet in the oven for 25 minutes.
After 25 minutes, take out baking sheet and mix everything up and spread back out on baking sheet.
Put baking sheet back in the oven for 20 more minutes.
Take baking sheet out and let cool for 5 minutes.
Mix 2 1/2 cup flour, 1/4 cup sugar, and 1/2 tbsp salt in a bowl.
Cut frozen butter into 1/4" slices and mix into bowl with flour, sugar, and salt.
Using a pastry blender, cut and mix in butter until you have small 1/4" to 1/8" chunks of butter mixed in.
Pour in a little cold Fireball and mix with a spatula.
Pour in a little cold water and mix with a spatula.
Keep pouring in a little Fireball and water and mix until dough looks like slightly larger DippingDots.
Mix dough by hand until it all sticks together. It should become very shaggy and seem like it's not going to stick together.
Cut dough in half and flatten into 2 disks about 3/4" thick, wrap in cling wrap, and store in fridge over night.
Peel and cut all apples into 1/2" thick slices.
Coat apples with 1/2 cup of sugar and let apples drain in a colander into a bowl for at least an hour.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Take 1 pie crust dough disk out of the fridge and roll out until it can completely drape into a 9" pie pan and hand over the edges a bit.
Add pie crust weights on top of dough in pan and let bake for about 10 mins.
Let crust cool and then trim off edges.
Take apples out of colander and put in a large bowl.
Reduce apple juice from apple slices in pan for about 10 mins until it gets thick.
Mix reduced apple juice, apple jelly, remaining sugar, remaining flour, and soft butter together.
Pour apple mixture into pre-baked crust.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Take the other pie crust dough disk out of the fridge and roll out until it is about 1/8" thick. It should be a little bigger than the other pie crust you rolled out.
Cut into 3/4" strips and weave into a basket weave pattern on top of the apples in the pan.
Cut crust strips so about 1/2" hangs off the edge of the pie pan. Tuck hanging strip under the bottom crust edge.
Crack egg into a cup and mix up. Brush egg onto woven pie crust and sprinkle with sugar.
Place pie on the bottom rack for 30 mins.
Cover pie with tin foil. Reduce oven heat to 360 degrees F.
Let pie bake for about 20 more minutes or until filling is bubbling.
Take pie out of the oven and let is cool completely. This usually takes about 4 hours.

recipeComments.comment: Wish I had tried a different recipe. This one was sooooo bland and my family didn't like it very much. Maybe it would taste better if I ate it with something else.
I've tried to make brussels sprouts so many different ways and this was by far the best
This recipe has completely changed my mind on what brussels sprouts can be
Not a bad way to make these
Took longer than I expected, but this crust is worth it!
